stories.text: Looks like a new UX/Manipulation tactic that they've employed to force people to click on the video in an attempt to seek, which takes them to videos page. That page is designed to get you to watch more videos.
stories.title: Facebook Removed Seek Bar in Videos on Home Feed
A Cryptocurrency Binance trading bot that analyses Reddit sentiment

stories.text:
As a candidate, the problems I've faced on AL are:

- often not enough info in the job postings I come across

- it's too easy to apply (this makes my application one in a hundred)

- my applications stay pending for days (or weeks sometimes)

As a hiring manager:

- far too much noise. Candidates who are completely unqualified, not in the locations I'm hiring in, or too junior apply

- not great if I'm hiring for fractional, freelance/part-time, or contract roles (doing more of this now)

- copy/paste (cover letter) applications

- no way to get senior talent to consider applying (for all the problems outlined above)

What is good:

- salary/equity info

- free (unless you're sourcing)

- quick to get started
stories.title: Ask HN: What would a (much) better AngelList look like?

stories.text:
I have recently started to get about 5-10 emails per week from startups who want me to have a quick chat with them about their ground breaking thing.

This is on my personal email that I don't give out and have been able to keep fairly spam free since 2006.

Do I have any recourse under can-spam? None of the email are "mass mail", but they are unsolicited, and they are from real people.

How can I find out who has my email and delete it from there?
stories.title: Ask HN: How can I unsubscribe myself from some startup recruitment tool?
